metadata.title: CVE-2020-15652 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
By observing the stack trace for JavaScript errors in web workers, it waspossible to leak the result of a cross-origin redirect. This applied onlyto content that can be parsed as script. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 79, Firefox ESR < 68.11, Firefox ESR < 78.1, Thunderbird < 68.11, andThunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
